definition: enemy/to be a match for/to rival/to resist/to withstand
special/unique/distinguished/especially/unusual/very/abbr. for 特克斯[te4 ke4 si1], tex
enemy agents in our midst/reds under the beds

sentences.english: Be vigilant against the danger of enemy agents infiltrating the government and boring from within.
sentences.chinese: 警惕敌特渗入政府内部进行暗中破坏。

sentences.english: Tne new code baffled the enemy agents.
sentences.chinese: 这套新密码使敌特机关束手无策。

sentences.english: The new code baffled the enemy agents.
sentences.chinese: 这套新密码使敌特机关束手无策。

sentences.english: He was examined on (the) suspicion of being an enemy agent.
sentences.chinese: 他因敌特嫌疑而受审查。

sentences.english: She betrayed state secrets to enemy agents.
sentences.chinese: 她向敌特泄露了国家机密。

sentences.english: The organization was infiltrated by the police.
sentences.chinese: 敌特已打入我们整个组织。

sentences.english: Several journalists were found to be hand and glove with enemy agents.
sentences.chinese: 有几位新闻记者被查出与敌特勾结。

sentences.english: We discovered him to be an enemy spy.
sentences.chinese: 我们发现他是一名敌特。

sentences.english: This is a plan to round up the enemy spies.
sentences.chinese: 这是个围歼敌特的计划。

sentences.english: Our entire organization had been infiltrated by enemy agents .
sentences.chinese: 敌特已打入我们整个组织。

sentences.english: We discovered that he was an enemy spy.
sentences.chinese: 我们发现他是一名敌特。

sentences.english: Several policemen tackled the enemy spy and got him down.
sentences.chinese: 几个警察揪住了敌特，把他摔倒在地。

sentences.english: He was examined on suspicion of being an enemy agent .
sentences.chinese: 他因敌特嫌疑而受审查。

sentences.english: Front of the situation is grim, furious behind enemy agents.
sentences.chinese: 前方形势严峻，后方敌特猖狂。

definition: Communist Party/abbr. for 共產黨|共产党[Gong4 chan3 dang3]
communist bandit (i.e. PLA soldier (during the civil war) or Chinese communist (Tw))
